p.s: Trade schools or vocational schools offer hands-on , practical training for professions that require a working knowledge of a particular field .
There are many different types of trade schools , ranging from esthetician and culinary schools to carpentry and auto repair schools .
If you 're an expert in a specific trade , and you enjoy sharing your knowledge , you may want to find out how to open a trade school .
It 's important to know that , in order to open a trade school , you 'll need a sound business plan as well as permission from your local and state government .
Planning the process properly is crucial to its success .

item.s: Determine which type of trade school you want to open .
Usually , you 'll want to open a school in your field of expertise so you can evaluate every aspect of the trade school 's function .
Investigate whether there 's a demand for this type of trade school in your area .
Find out if there 's any competition in the area and if that will hamper your startup plans .
Find out what trade certifications you need , such as welder 's , plumber 's or electrician 's certificate .
Draw up a business plan that can serve as a funding application to the state .
Explain the curriculum you plan to offer and the types of instructors you want to attract .
Define the demand for the school in the area by analyzing job statistics and educational statistics .
Describe the costs of starting up the school , including location , materials , educator contracts , insurance and taxes .
Outline your income projections for the first 2 years .
Register your trade school with the appropriate local and state organizations .
Raise the capital to open a trade school by getting a business loan from a bank or obtaining state or private funding .
Find a location for your trade school .
Make sure it 's easily accessible and offers the potential to adapt it to a safe learning environment .
Adapt the location for your trade school .
Remember to have it evaluated by your local fire department to determine whether it meets all safety requirements .
Get insurance for your trade school .
This includes insurance for the building and its contents , as well as liability insurance and any other type of insurance you deem necessary .
Purchase all necessary equipment .
The types of equipment will depend on the trade you 're teaching .
Draw up contracts for your staff as well as admission agreements for students .
Interview and hire educators .
Choose applicants who are qualified and experienced in the trade and in front of a class .
Install a security system with armed response to protect the school and everybody in it from crime , fire and other hazards .
Launch a marketing plan to attract pupils .
This can include advertising at schools , in newspapers , on billboards and on local television .
Enroll your students for the first year .
Open your trade school .
Always keep in contact with trade unions to stay abreast of the latest developments in your field .
Always consider creating a website that offers internship and job opportunities for students and alumni .
